Taking the size of pointer TargetKeyName: This will yield the size of a pointer (4 or 8), not the size of the object pointed to. Dereference the pointer, or if the size of a pointer was intended, use the pointer type or (void *) instead.

Taking the size of pointer TargetValueName: This will yield the size of a pointer (4 or 8), not the size of the object pointed to. Dereference the pointer, or if the size of a pointer was intended, use the pointer type or (void *) instead.
